title: Help ID This Font
content:
Can someone please put a name to this font?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045839im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SafeGuard%5BTrustAtlanticBank%5BAnthonyBC)
]\_5563.jpg]
 [‹ Type id please](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045839/http:/typophile.com/node/56062 "Go to previous forum topic") [Does anyone know what typeface this is? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045839/http:/typophile.com/node/56050 "Go to next forum topic")
author: paispais

comments.content: I can identify the use of the cap and small cap together as having an unbalanced weight distribution. Other than that, I’ve got nothing.

I agree with you, brockfrench. It is poorly balanced and uugggly. It’s part of a logo that belongs to a client and they are totally clueless about the typeface.

Thanks for trying though!

It looks like [Cantoria](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045839/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=cantoria) with fake small caps.

- Lex

Maybe this will help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045839im_/http:/typophile.com/files/help2_4773.jpg)

Who ever created this logo stretched the leg on the R, which is actually suppose to look like the leg of the K in the bank image.

Yay! I believe Cantoria is the name of this font.

Thank you Lex!
